subjectLine.example: Recommendation Request for Stanford Summer Research Program

body.description: Complete email content including greeting, main content, and signature
body.example:
Dear Professor Chen,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to request a letter of recommendation for the Stanford Summer Research Program. As a student in your Advanced Biology course last semester (Fall 2024) where I earned an A, I believe you could speak to my research capabilities and academic performance.

Best regards,
Student Name

commonMistakes.description: Sending the request too late (less than 2 weeks before deadline)
Not providing specific details about the program or position being applied to
Failing to mention specific class experiences or projects that demonstrate your capabilities
Not offering alternative formats for the letter submission (online portal, email, physical mail)

scenario.context: You need a recommendation letter for a summer research program at Stanford University. The deadline is in 3 weeks, and you took Professor Chen's Advanced Biology course last semester, earning an A.
requirements: Your specific connection to the professor

aiFeedbackPoints: Analysis of how well you've established your academic connection and performance
Evaluation of clarity in program details and timeline presentation
Assessment of professionalism and courtesy in the request

checklistItems.description: Mentioned specific course name, semester, and grade
Included clear program deadline and submission method
Attached all referenced documents (resume, transcript)
Provided program name and specific position details
Included a proposed follow-up timeline

subjectLine.example: Thank You and NASA JPL Recommendation Request

body.description: Complete email content including gratitude and recommendation request
body.example:
Dear Dr. Martinez,

I wanted to express my sincere gratitude for your mentorship over the past two years. Your guidance has been instrumental in my academic journey.

I am applying for the NASA JPL internship and would greatly appreciate a letter of recommendation that highlights our research work together.

Best regards,
Student Name

commonMistakes.description: Forgetting to express gratitude for previous guidance before making the request
Not explaining why you're specifically asking this advisor (vs others)
Not providing a clear timeline for when you need the recommendation
Failing to mention specific achievements or growth under their advisorship

scenario.context: You've worked with your advisor Dr. Martinez for two years. You're applying for a competitive internship at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory and need a recommendation highlighting your research experience.
requirements: Requests a recommendation with specific details about the internship

aiFeedbackPoints: Analysis of how effectively you've highlighted your research relationship
Evaluation of gratitude expression and personal growth demonstration
Assessment of clarity in internship relevance to your path

checklistItems.description: Expressed specific examples of valuable mentorship
Included detailed internship program information
Mentioned specific research projects or achievements
Provided clear deadline and submission instructions
Included a graceful 'out' if they're unable to help

body.description: Complete email content including situation explanation and makeup plan
body.example:
Dear Professor Thompson,

I regret to inform you that I have developed a high fever and will not be able to attend tomorrow's Marketing Strategy presentation. I have already informed my group members and can present my portion next week.

Best regards,
Student Name

commonMistakes.description: Being too casual or providing unnecessary medical details
Not proposing a plan to catch up on missed work
Waiting too long to notify the professor about the absence
Not acknowledging the impact on team members or class activities

scenario.context: You've developed a high fever and won't be able to attend tomorrow's important presentation in your Marketing Strategy class.
requirements: Addresses how you'll handle any group work impacts

aiFeedbackPoints: Analysis of professionalism in explaining the situation
Evaluation of proactiveness in providing solutions
Assessment of consideration for group impact

checklistItems.description: Stated absence timing and duration clearly
Proposed specific make-up presentation date(s)
Outlined plan for group work coordination
Mentioned willingness to provide documentation if needed
Included plan to catch up on missed material

subjectLine.example: Introduction Request - Apple Design Team Connection

body.description: Complete email content including research, value proposition, and forwardable introduction
body.example:
Dear [Mentor Name],

I noticed your LinkedIn connection with Jane Smith, Head of Design at Apple. I've been following her work on user-centered design principles and would greatly appreciate an introduction to learn more about her career path.

Best regards,
[Your name]

commonMistakes.description: Not explaining how you found the person you want to be introduced to
Making the request too demanding on the connector's time
Failing to provide a draft introduction message that can be forwarded
Not demonstrating value or mutual benefit in the connection

scenario.context: You noticed your alumni mentor is connected to the Head of Design at Apple, and you'd love to learn more about their career path.
requirements: Makes it easy for your mentor to forward/connect

aiFeedbackPoints: Analysis of how well you've demonstrated your research
Evaluation of the value proposition for both parties
Assessment of how easy you've made it for the connector

checklistItems.description: Explained specific reason for wanting to connect
Included a draft forward-able message
Demonstrated knowledge of target contact's work
Provided clear, specific ask for the introduction
Included your relevant background briefly

subjectLine.example: Database Management Final Project - Technical Issue and Resubmission Request

body.description: Complete email content including issue explanation, documentation, and resubmission proposal
body.example:
Dear Professor Johnson,

I experienced a technical issue while submitting my Database Management final project. My laptop crashed during submission at 11:58 PM, causing me to miss the midnight deadline. I have attached the IT support documentation and would like to request permission to resubmit.

Best regards,
[Your name]

commonMistakes.description: Not taking full responsibility for the situation
Making excuses instead of providing solutions
Failing to provide proper documentation or evidence of the technical issue
Not acknowledging the instructor's time and effort in accommodating the request

scenario.context: Your laptop crashed while submitting your final project for Database Management, causing you to miss the deadline by 2 hours. You have documentation from IT support about the incident.
requirements: Acknowledges any late penalties that may apply

aiFeedbackPoints: Assessment of documentation and timeline clarity

checklistItems.description: Clearly explained the technical issue timing
Attached relevant documentation/evidence
Proposed specific resubmission timeline
Acknowledged any applicable penalties
Included preventive measures for future submissions
